description: Cluster level overview of workloads deployed, based on prometheus metrics exposed by kubelet, node-exporter, nginx ingress controller

panels.description:
max
node is either Down or under abnormal condition :

- Ready	True if the node is healthy and ready to accept pods, False if the node is not healthy and is not accepting pods, and Unknown if the node controller has not heard from the node in the last node-monitor-grace-period (default is 40 seconds)
- DiskPressure	True if pressure exists on the disk size—that is, if the disk capacity is low; otherwise False
- MemoryPressure	True if pressure exists on the node memory—that is, if the node memory is low; otherwise False
- PIDPressure	True if pressure exists on the processes—that is, if there are too many processes on the node; otherwise False
- NetworkUnavailable	True if the network for the node is not correctly configured, otherwise False

targets.expr: count((kube_node_status_condition{condition="Ready", status!="true"} == 1) OR ON(node) (kube_node_status_condition{condition!="Ready", status="true"} == 1)) OR vector(0)

panels.title: Abnormal Nodes

panels.description: cumulated max IOPS over all nodes
panels.title: Disk IOPS

panels.title: Rabbit Nodes

panels.description:
max
node is either Down or under abnormal condition :

- Ready	True if the node is healthy and ready to accept pods, False if the node is not healthy and is not accepting pods, and Unknown if the node controller has not heard from the node in the last node-monitor-grace-period (default is 40 seconds)
- DiskPressure	True if pressure exists on the disk size—that is, if the disk capacity is low; otherwise False
- MemoryPressure	True if pressure exists on the node memory—that is, if the node memory is low; otherwise False
- PIDPressure	True if pressure exists on the processes—that is, if there are too many processes on the node; otherwise False
- NetworkUnavailable	True if the network for the node is not correctly configured, otherwise False
panels.title: Abnormal nodes

panels.description: due to prometheus scrape interval and the size of the step variables, there could be more points in this figure than the actual number of restart
panels.title: Pods Restarted
Kubelet runtime operations errors from sysdig

panels.description:
Should always be null (no data).
Sometimes a pod can have OOMkill at linux container level and still be healthy at kuberntes level and not restarted by kubernetes.
Due to prometheus scrape interval and the size of the step variables, there could be more points in this figure than the actual number of OOMkill.
panels.title: OOM kill

panels.description: The number of requests handled by kube-apiserver per second, excluding CONNECT, WATCH, and WATCHLIST
panels.title: APIServer Requests

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(apiserver_request_duration_seconds_bucket{verb!~"CONNECT|WATCH"}[$step])) by (verb, group, instance, resource, le)) >0

panels.description: rate of request in the top quantiles of latencies (>=10s) for APIserver
panels.title: Worst APIserver latency actors

title: Kubernetes Cluster overview
